title: Camera/Game Freeze on Mouse Movement
body: So I decided to play my first ranked game of the season today when I noticed i was getting random freezes for about 1-2 seconds. I then realized that the only time I would get freeze/lag was when I moved my mouse. Whether I was moving the camera with the mouse or just moving to click on a minion or something I would freeze, and the longer i had moved the mouse without stopping the longer the freeze. This caused me to lose my first ranked game and thus I tried to fix it. I changed my graphics settings, camera settings, and mouse settings to no avail. I repaired the game files and still nothing. Now whenever I am in game I get this freeze with the slightest mouse movement, but everything is fine out of a game. Anyone have any solutions? I cant for the life of me play with this irritating freeze.

replies.body:
Hey Peeksnon,

This sometimes happens when you have a corruption in one of your game files. You may be able to resolve this weird lag by deleting your game.cfg and input.ini. This will reset all of your settings and should clear any corrupt data that may be causing your freezing. It's located on your computer at this location:

Your Default Install location (It's usually C:\) > Riot Games > League of Legends > Config
What to do when my screen freezes until I move my mouse? In other words, my screen freezes when my mouse is not moving.

I still don't understand why in-game is fine, and there is no lag or anything, but the second that I start moving my mouse it freezes until i let go of the mouse and stop moving it around. If i were to leave the mouse going in the right direction without touching it the camera pans with no freeze or issues, but if i were to make a sudden mouse movement up and then stop it will freeze for a second then it will move the camera (and actually it will overshoot the camera because of the freeze). I had just played the day before the patch was applied and everything was as it should be. I have restarted the computer, checked for windows/driver updates, but everything is fine until the second i get into game and start moving the mouse. Once I am out of the game everything is fine, even in the matchmaking lobby, etc.

This fixed a problem for me; when I was in game, every 10 minutes or so, everyone would move around but no spell/cast/animations of any sort would show up. It went on for about 10 seconds with minions and players in place just sliding around until it all came "unstuck" and sped up to current game. I could cast spells and time the abilities/place wards... do everything normally, just graphically; it was shot for 10 seconds.

Deleting those two files fixed it.
